dt: {bc}any of several mostly flat dark areas of considerable extent on the surface of the moon or Mars

shortdef: any of several mostly flat dark areas of considerable extent on the surface of the moon or Mars

dt: {bc}a female horse or other {d_link|equine|equine} animal especially when fully mature or of breeding age

et: Middle English, from Old English {it}mere{/it}; akin to Old High German {it}merha{/it} mare, Old English {it}mearh{/it} horse, Welsh {it}march{/it}
shortdef: a female horse or other equine animal especially when fully mature or of breeding age

et: Middle English, from Old English; akin to Old High German {it}mara{/it} incubus, Serbo-Croatian {it}mora{/it} nightmare
shortdef: an evil preternatural being causing nightmares

dt: {bc}a wrestling maneuver in which an opponent is seized by the wrist and thrown to the ground by being pulled over the back of the aggressor

shortdef: a wrestling maneuver in which an opponent is seized by the wrist and thrown to the ground by being pulled over the back of the aggressor

dt: {bc}a false discovery, illusion, or deliberate hoax
{bc}a place, condition, or situation of great disorder or confusion

dt.t: a {it}mare's nest{/it} of intrigue and troubles with the money men

shortdef: a false discovery, illusion, or deliberate hoax
a place, condition, or situation of great disorder or confusion

dt: {bc}a common aquatic plant ({it}Hippuris vulgaris{/it} of the family Hippuridaceae) with elongated shoots having dense whorls of narrow finely tapered leaves
{bc}a cirrus cloud that has a long slender flowing appearance

shortdef: a common aquatic plant (Hippuris vulgaris of the family Hippuridaceae) with elongated shoots having dense whorls of narrow finely tapered leaves
a cirrus cloud that has a long slender flowing appearance
